p: Analysis of the FAME (Fatty Acid Methyl Ester) was performed according to Siano et al. [ 22]. The samples of crude extracted oil and Soxhelet-extracted lipids from seeds and flour (about 0.2 g) were transferred into Pyrex test tubes with screw caps, and 2 mL of 1.25 N HCl-CH 3OH solution was added. Samples were incubated in a water bath at 90 °C for 60 min. FAME was extracted with n-hexane, after the addition of 2 mL of distilled water. The organic phase was filtered using Millex 0.45 μm PVDF disposable syringe filters (EMD Millipore Corp., Billerica, MA, USA) and 1 μL was directly injected into the gas chromatograph for analysis.
